page.title: 05ALL SAINTS CHURCH
page.content: The All Saints church in Southill is a fairly large church with two beautiful stained glass windows.The huge organ is situated at the end of the church surrounded by carved oak wood panels.The church is used by all the people in the parish from Stanford,Southill and Broom.There is work and pictures from the monthly 'Saturday club'decorating the walls of the church as well as the{traditional} flower arrangements.The altar is covered in a white drape with a black cross embroidered on it.On top of the altar there are two candles in brass holders and a brass cross.On the walls of the church there are many plaques in memory of people who died, dating back to the seventeen eighties. On each side of the church there are four white pillars and rows of wooden pews.
